user_query: Dell laptop Wi-Fi keeps disconnecting after sleep. How to fix?
model_answer: Try updating the Wi-Fi driver, disable 'Allow the computer to turn off this device' in Device Manager, and run Windows Network Troubleshooter. If it persists, update BIOS and power management settings.
retrieved_contexts: To prevent Wi-Fi adapter power save issues: Device Manager > Network adapters > Properties > Power Management > uncheck 'Allow the computer to turn off this device'.
Dell support recommends updating BIOS and chipset drivers for sleep/hibernate networking issues.
